parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate.  The event is a lecture on social media and violence, not related to any specific candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, promoting a public lecture. It is intended to reach a wide audience, not just specific individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote a public lecture on social media and violence. There is no indication that the event aims to influence the outcome of any election.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The event appears to be a discussion on a topic of public interest, aligning with journalistic principles of informing and educating the public. The speakers' credentials (journalist and criminology lecturer) further support this interpretation.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions related to any candidate or party.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2571686593020311</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a public lecture on "Social Media and the Theatre of Violence." The event is organized by Mathias Corvinus Collegium, and the speakers are a journalist and a criminology lecturer.  The content of the lecture is not directly related to the parliamentary elections. The post does not mention any political candidates or parties, nor does it advocate for or against any particular candidate or party. The paid advertisement aims to inform the public about the lecture, not to influence the vote in any election. Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 and Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>MCC</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
